body: Will adding another interop machine ease this problem?
It will probably just freeze less often.

Here's a run when the worker got stuck:
https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_master/3372/

Output from serial console 


Yesterday I added a new interop worker (grpc-canary-interop2) that is based off of ubuntu 15.10 image (interop1 has ubuntu 14.04). 
Having a newer linux kernel could help solving the docker problem.
The new worker has "interopnew" label and I redirected gRPC_interop_master and gRPC_interop_pull_requests to run with this label. Let's see if the worker gets stuck at some point.
So far, the new worker with ubuntu 15.10 seems to be working fine (all the old worker got stuck since the time I've made the change already), so I assume this was fixed and will reopen if seen again.

Turns out with the new grpc-canary-interop2 worker this is still an issue (but seems to happen less often).

The new grpc-canary-interop2 only gets stuck very rarely, so closing this for now.
